DataElement.preferredName: Maximum Serum Creatinine Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performance Result Integer::4 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 4 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of maximum serum creatinine in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Maximum Serum Creatinine Measurement Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The largest possible quantity or degree._A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

A quantitative measurement of the amount of creatinine present in a sample of serum.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Result Integer::4 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::4 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::4:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
